snippet: Gunmen stormed a Radisson Blu hotel on Friday morning in Bamako, seizing scores of hostages and leaving bodies strewn across parts of the building.
abstract: Gunmen attack Radisson Blu hotel in Bamako, Mali, killing at least 19 people and taking scores of hostages; remains unclear who is responsible for attack, but Mali has long struggled with insurrection and Islamist extremism.

byline.original: By DIONNE SEARCEY and ADAM NOSSITER
byline.contributor: Dionne Searcey reported from Dakar, Senegal, and Adam Nossiter from Paris. Reporting was contributed by Cheick Diouara, Katarina Hoije and Serge Daniel from Bamako, Mali; Rukmini Callimachi, Lilia Blaise and Nabih Bulos from Paris; Saskia de Rothschild from Abidjan, Ivory Coast; Jane Perlez from Beijing; Eric Schmitt and Helene Cooper from Washington; Somini Sengupta from the United Nations; and Michael Schwirtz from New York.

lead_paragraph: Gunmen stormed a Radisson Blu hotel on Friday morning in Bamako, seizing scores of hostages and leaving bodies strewn across parts of the building.

headline.main: Deadly Siege Ends After Assault on Hotel in Mali
headline.print_headline: Deadly Siege Ends After an Assault on a Mali Hotel
